member.name: T:BaseAction
member.para: A part action
member.remarks: - A BaseAction object is the basic action object. There is one of these automatically created for each 'KSPAction' field in a partModule

member.name: F:BaseAction.actionGroup
member.para: Added to action groups here the event will fire on activate
member.remarks: - Bitmap of the action groups this action is currently assigned to. Example:

member.name: F:BaseAction.active
member.para: Set to false to remove visibilty from editor and stop this action from firing
member.remarks:
- Is this action available? Setting this false disables the action so it will not show in the available actions list.
Note this totally disables the action, even calling it in code will not execute the action if this bool is false. (As of KSP 0.90, assumed still true in KSP 1.1)

member.name: F:BaseAction.advancedTweakable
member.para: Does the action require advanced tweakables?

member.name: F:BaseAction.defaultActionGroup
member.para: Added to action groups here the event will fire on activate
member.remarks:
- Assign this action to action groups upon creation ('Gear' group for landing legs)
Set the default group to Brakes only:
Add the Custom01 group to the default groups.

Note this value is only used when a part is placed in the editor and the values in defaultActionGroup are transferred to actionGroup at that time. Once a part is placed in the editor (or in flight mode) use the actionGroup object instead.

member.name: F:BaseAction.guiName
member.summary: Name shown in editor action groups panel, can safely be edited as any other string.

member.name: F:BaseAction.isPersistent
member.para: Does this action get its active field serialized?

member.name: F:BaseAction.listParent
member.summary: Information about what the action is attached to. listParent.module = partModule this action is a memeber of listParent.part = part this action is a member of

member.name: F:BaseAction.name
member.para: The exposed name of this action method
member.remarks: - Name of the action group as seen in code where the KSPAction field exists. Do not edit, this is the identifier of the action as used in code and is not player visible. (See guiName for what is visible in game.)

member.name: F:BaseAction.requireFullControl
member.para: Does this require full, not just partial, control?

member.name: P:BaseAction.guiName
member.para: The name of this action presented in the gui (user readable name)

member.name: P:BaseAction.onEvent
member.para: The delegate method this action fires

member.name: M:BaseAction.Invoke(KSPActionParam)
member.summary: Activate this action. Note that there is no toggle activation, you must check state yourself in code and activate or deactivate as appropriate **Example code start to activate an action: KSP version 0.24.2**
member.code: KSPActionParam actParam = new KSPActionParam(KSPActionGroup.None, KSPActionType.Activate); //okay to create this new just before invoking exampleAction.Invoke(actParam); //action defined as a KSPAction in a partModule
member.remarks: **Example code start to deactivate an action: KSP version 0.24.2**
member.code: KSPActionParam actParam = new KSPActionParam(KSPActionGroup.None, KSPActionType.Deactivate); //okay to create this new just before invoking exampleAction.Invoke(actParam); //action defined as a KSPAction in a partModule

member.name: F:BaseConverter.AlwaysActive
member.summary: Simply means that this converter is "always on" once turned on (and cannot be shut off), or that it is "always on" when in active view.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.AutoShutdown
member.summary: Simply means that the converter shuts down after a predetermined set of conditions are met; such as "resource(s) full" or "used up".

member.name: F:BaseConverter.ConverterName
member.summary: The name of the converter as it should appear in-game to players.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.DefaultShutoffTemp
member.summary: Shuts off the converter after a certain temperature is reached. Definable?

member.name: F:BaseConverter.Efficiency
member.summary: A math coefficient. Let's say you've set your Input and Output levels all to 1.0 ... set your Efficiency to any number from 0.01 to 1.0 (1~100%), and now you've defined how efficient you want your converter to be. Play around with your Input and Output values as desired to get the effects you're looking for.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.EfficiencyBonus
member.para: When determining final efficiency (which is multiplied against all inputs and outputs of a recipe), the EfficiencyBonus will be factored in (multiplied). Defaults to 1 (i.e. no effect), and is persistent.
member.remarks: - Defines whether to *use* an Efficiency Bonus or not. 0 to not use it, 1 to use it.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.EfficiencyModifiers
member.para: When determining final efficiency (which is multiplied against all inputs and outputs of a recipe), each EfficiencyMultiplier will be factored in (multiplied) in sequence. Use for when you want to handle multiple efficiency bonuses.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.ExperienceEffect
member.summary: Based on http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/113131-moduleresourceconverter-documentation/ : is the level of the highest-level engineer on the vessel. Complete formula: Eff = EB * (SBB + [SEF * EE]), where EB is EfficiencyBonus, SBB is SpecialistBaseBonus, SEF is SpecialistEfficiencyFactor, and EE is ExperienceEffect. EE ranges from 0 (no specialist), 2 (1-star engineer), to 6 (5-star engineer).

member.name: F:BaseConverter.FillAmount
member.summary: How much to make before shutting down, ie "fill it up". If the tank is emptied, is likely able to be filled again.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.GeneratesHeat
member.summary: Whether the converter generates heat during the conversion process.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.inputList
member.summary: Literally the resource we're putting *in* to be converted. Can only be one resource per entry; ie, can't rattle off two or more resources in a single entry slot. Instead, make a new entry and add a single resource to that, then repeat with new entries down the list. Strongly recommend reading the 'ResourceRatio' to view the correct way to build the list.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.IsActivated
member.summary: A check to see if the convertor has been activated -- we need this to help toggle other events in the Config Code (Animations and such). Compare to If/Then/And statements? (Needs verification) :: (Could this one also be a check to "autostart/autostop" it if the parent MODULE has been activated, such as ModuleAnimateGeneric?)

member.name: F:BaseConverter.lastUpdateTime
member.summary: Time of the last (physics?) update.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.outputList
member.summary: Literally the resource we want made. Can only be one resource per entry; ie, can't rattle off two or more resources in a single entry slot. Instead, make a new entry and add a single resource to that, then repeat with new entries down the list. Strongly recommend reading the 'ResourceRatio' to view the correct way to build the list.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.SpecialistBonusBase
member.summary: Simply a math function to determine how much of a bonus we get for having a Specialist on board the vessel we're using the converter with. Careful with this number, because it's a multiplier! Based on http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/113131-moduleresourceconverter-documentation/ : is the base factor by which efficiency is multiplied. Complete formula: Eff = EB * (SBB + [SEF * EE]), where EB is EfficiencyBonus, SBB is SpecialistBaseBonus, SEF is SpecialistEfficiencyFactor, and EE is ExperienceEffect. If less effect from engineers is desired, tweak SBB towards 1.0, and SEF downwards.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.SpecialistEfficiencyFactor
member.para: How much each level of the specified ExperienceEffect will increase efficiency
member.remarks: - How *quickly* the converter works with the Specialist on-board. Better speed = better efficiency. Based on http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/113131-moduleresourceconverter-documentation/ : is the factor, multiplied by engineer level, that is added to SpecialistBaseBonus to determine the overall efficiency. Complete formula: Eff = EB * (SBB + [SEF * EE]), where EB is EfficiencyBonus, SBB is SpecialistBaseBonus, SEF is SpecialistEfficiencyFactor, and EE is ExperienceEffect.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.SpecialistHeatFactor
member.para: How much each level of the specified ExperienceEffect will reduce heat

member.name: F:BaseConverter.Specialty
member.summary: Which career makes this converter more efficient? If left blank, there's no difference, and it receives NO bonuses.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.StartActionName
member.summary: Likely the description next to the button to commence a resource conversion. This should be set in the craft's .cfg file. A right-click button will be created for the part during a flight scene with this name.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.status
member.summary: Probably best to not use this one, as this could cause issues if tampered with.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.StopActionName
member.summary: The complement of StartActionName, this stops the resource conversion. This should be set in the craft's .cfg file. A right-click button will be created for the part during a flight scene with this name.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.TemperatureModifier
member.summary: Does this converter get more (or less) efficient due to temperature? That's defined here, and is an array like ThermalEfficiency below.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.ThermalEfficiency
member.summary: This is a definable array of different efficiencies over different temperatures. Opening the file /GameData/Squad/Parts/Resources/ISRU/ISRU.cfg and scrolling down to the thermalEfficiency section(s) will provide good examples of how this function is actually used.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.ToggleActionName
member.summary: As with StartActionName and StopActionName, ToggleActionName is the GUI name that the Player actually sees in-game for the converter when they right-click the equipped part. The toggle function is a combination start/stop button.

member.name: F:BaseConverter.UseSpecialistBonus
member.para: Whether or not crew experience effects should affect efficiency of the converter
member.remarks: - If true, the converter will gain efficiency bonus if a crewmember is on board (defined in Specialty).

member.name: F:BaseConverter.UseSpecialistHeatBonus
member.para: Whether or not crew experience effects should decrease heat generation of the converter

member.name: M:BaseConverter.GetCrewEfficiencyBonus
member.para: Returns a value used to scale efficiency based on the highest rated crew member with the appropriate specialty (if specialty bonuses are enabled).

member.name: M:BaseConverter.GetCrewHeatBonus
member.para: Returns a value used to scale thermal efficiency based on the highest rated crew member with the appropriate specialty (if specialty bonuses are enabled).

member.name: F:CelestialBody.bodyDisplayName

member.name: F:CelestialBody.bodyName
member.para: This is the Celestial Body name text. It will always be in English.
member.remarks: - The name of the body, as a string.

member.name: F:CelestialBody.GeeASL
member.summary: The gravitational acceleration of the body at sea level, in units of gees (1 gee = 9.81 m/s^2)

member.name: F:CelestialBody.gMagnitudeAtCenter
member.summary: The gravitational acceleration (in m/s^2) at a radius r (in m) from the body's center is gMagnitudeAtCenter / r^2

member.name: F:CelestialBody.gravParameter
member.summary: The gravitational parameter GM is the universal gravitational constant G times the mass M of the body. In KSP the gravitational constant G is exactly 6.673 m^3 / (kg s^2), and the body mass is measured in kilograms.

member.name: F:CelestialBody.hillSphere

member.name: F:CelestialBody.orbitingBodies

member.name: F:CelestialBody.pqsController

member.name: M:CelestialBody.GetLatitude(Vector3d)

member.param: A position in world coordinates
member.returns: Latitude in degrees

member.name: M:CelestialBody.GetLongitude(Vector3d)
member.summary: Gets the longitude of a given position, in degrees. Note that you CANNOT count on this value being in any particular range. This function may for example return 420, meaning 60 degrees east. You would be well advised to coerce it into a standard range like -180 to 180 before using it.
member.param: A position in world coordinates
member.returns: Longitude in degrees

<simplesect kind='return'>
A normalized radial vector, relative to planet space</simplesect>

member.name: M:CelestialBody.GetRelSurfacePosition(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.para: Returns a planet-relative position, given the latitude, longitude and altitude. (takes into account planet rotation)

member.param: Latitude in degrees
Longitude in degrees
Altitude above sea level in meters
member.returns: A position vector relative to the center of the body

member.name: M:CelestialBody.GetRelSurfacePosition(Vector3d)
member.para: Returns a planet-relative position, given the world space position

member.name: M:CelestialBody.getRFrmVel(Vector3d)
member.summary: Returns the velocity at a given position of the frame of reference that rotates with the planet. This velocity is the difference between the "orbit" and "surface" velocities.
member.param: A position in world coordinates
member.returns: Velocity of the rotating reference frame

member.name: M:CelestialBody.GetSurfaceNVector(System.Double,System.Double)
member.para: Returns a normal vector, given the latitude and longitude (takes planet rotation into account)

<simplesect kind='return'>
A normalized vector, pointing to the resulting direction</simplesect>
member.remarks: - Returns a unit vector perpendicular to the surface of the body at the given latitude and longitude (pretending for the moment that the body is a perfect sphere).
member.param: Latitude in degrees
Longitude in degrees
member.returns: A unit normal vector to the surface

member.name: M:CelestialBody.GetTemperature(System.Double)
member.para: < baseValue += latitudeTemperatureBiasCurve.Evaluate(latitudeDot);

member.name: M:CelestialBody.GetWorldSurfacePosition(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.para: Returns a worldspace position, given the latitude, longitude and altitude. (takes into account planet rotation)
member.remarks: - Returns the position, in world coordinates, of a given latitude, longitude, and altitude
member.param: Latitude in degrees
Longitude in degrees
Altitude above sea level in meters
member.returns: Position in world coordinates

member.name: T:ConfigNode
member.para: Acts as a config file reader and writer. Contains a list of values and sub nodes. Can read or write itself or objects to files.
member.remarks: - A ConfigNode represents a collection of data that can be serialized to or deserialized from a file. A ConfigNode contains a set of values, and optionally one or more ConfigNodes, so they can be used recursively.

member.name: M:ConfigNode.CreateConfigFromObject(object)
member.para: Creates a <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> from any object. Uses reflection.

<parameterlist kind='param'><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>obj</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>Object to create <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> from
member.remarks: </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist> <simplesect kind='return'>
member.para: <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> representation
member.remarks: </simplesect> </para> - Create a ConfigNode from a given object. This function will use reflection to scan the given object looking for fields with the [Persistent] attribute. When it finds such a field it adds it as a name-value pair to the returned ConfigNode. The name wil be the name of the field, and the value will the the serialized version of the field's data.
member.param: The object to scan to create a ConfigNode
member.returns: A ConfigNode containing the persistent fields of the object.

member.name: M:ConfigNode.CreateConfigFromObject(object,ConfigNode)
member.para: Creates a <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> from any object. Uses reflection.

<parameterlist kind='param'><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>obj</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>Object to create <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> from
member.remarks: </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>node</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para><ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> to create data into</para></parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist> <simplesect kind='return'><para><ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> representation</para></simplesect> </para>

member.name: M:ConfigNode.CreateConfigFromObject(object,System.Int32)
member.para: Creates a <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> from any object. Uses reflection.

<parameterlist kind='param'><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>obj</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>Object to create <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> from
member.remarks: </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist> <simplesect kind='return'>
member.para: <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> representation
member.remarks: </simplesect> </para> - Like CreateConfigFromObject, but only pays attention to fields with the "pass" field of the [Persistent] attribute set to pass.
member.param: The object to scan to create a ConfigNode.
A flag indicate which fields to serialize.
member.returns: A ConfigNode containing the desired persistent fields of the object.

member.name: M:ConfigNode.CreateConfigFromObject(object,System.Int32,ConfigNode)
member.para: Creates a <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> from any object. Uses reflection.

member.name: M:ConfigNode.LoadObjectFromConfig(object,ConfigNode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Like LoadObjectFromConfig, but only pays attention to fields for which the "pass" field of the [Persistent] attribute is equal to pass.
member.param: The object to initialize
The ConfigNode used to initialize the object.
A flag indicating which fields to initialize.

member.name: M:ConfigNode.LoadObjectFromConfig(object,ConfigNode)
member.summary: Initialize an existing object using data from the ConfigNode. This method will scan the object looking for fields with the [Persistent] attribute. When it finds such a field, it looks in the ConfigNode for a matching name-value pair, and then parses the value and sets the field to the result.
member.param: The object to initialize
The ConfigNode used to initialize the object.

member.name: F:Contracts.Contract.AutoAccept
member.para: Whether this contract is automatically accepted after being offered by the contract system.

member.name: F:Contracts.Contract.FundsAdvance
member.para: The funds advance gained from accepting this mission

member.name: F:Contracts.Contract.FundsCompletion
member.para: The funds gained for completing the mission

member.name: F:Contracts.Contract.FundsFailure
member.para: The funds gained for failing the mission

member.name: F:Contracts.Contract.IgnoresWeight
member.para: Whether this contract ignores weight changes, always staying at default.

member.name: F:Contracts.Contract.ReputationCompletion
member.para: The reputation gain for completing the mission

member.name: F:Contracts.Contract.ReputationFailure
member.para: The reputation gain for failing to complete the mission before the deadline

member.name: F:Contracts.Contract.ScienceCompletion
member.para: The science gained for completing the mission

member.name: F:Contracts.Contract.TimeDeadline
member.para: The time duration from when this mission was accepted until the deadline is hit

member.name: F:Contracts.Contract.TimeExpiry
member.para: The time duration from when this mission was generated until it expires

member.name: P:Contracts.Contract.Agent
member.para: Space agency or organisation that is requesting this mission

member.name: P:Contracts.Contract.ContractGuid
member.para: Globally unique mission identifier (will be unique even for two contracts considered to be repeats (matching ContractIDs))

member.name: P:Contracts.Contract.ContractID
member.para: Unique mission identifier (combines mission name and parameters)

member.name: P:Contracts.Contract.Keywords
member.para: Keywords which help to score agent suitability for this contract

member.name: P:Contracts.Contract.KeywordsRequired
member.para: Keywords which MUST be matched by a mentality in order for agents/mentalities to be valid eg. A mentality which DOES NOT positively score these have these will fail verification (excludes others)

member.name: P:Contracts.Contract.MissionSeed
member.para: The seed that was used to generate the mission

member.name: P:Contracts.Contract.Prestige
member.para: Difficulty that this contract was generated for

member.name: M:Contracts.Contract.CanBeCancelled
member.para: If this contract can be cancelled

member.name: M:Contracts.Contract.CanBeDeclined
member.para: If this contract can be declined

member.name: M:Contracts.Contract.CanBeFailed
member.para: If this contract can fail

<parameterlist kind='param'><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>contractType</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>agency</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The name of the agency offering the contract
member.remarks: </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>topic</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>A string for a 'topic' that will be directly substituted in facts and other fields that mention it. Singular noun please.</para></parameterdescription> </parameteritem> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>subject</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>A string containing the subject matter at hand (usually a destination like a Celestial Body, <ref refid='class_orbit' kindref='compound'>Orbit</ref>, Srf, see StoryDefs.cfg for examples)</para></parameterdescription> </parameteritem> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>seed</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>A seed number, for retrieving the exact same string again when needed (mind the string parameters must also be the same)</para></parameterdescription> </parameteritem> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>allowGenericIntroduction</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>allowGenericProblem</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>allowGenericConclusion</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist> <simplesect kind='return'><para>A string telling the story, no guarantees on it making much sense.</para></simplesect> </para>

member.name: P:DiscoveryInfo.fadeUT
member.para: Time at which the object will disappear unless observed again.
member.remarks: - The time at which the asteroid is scheduled to be deleted

member.name: P:DiscoveryInfo.lastObservedTime
member.para: When was the object last observed.
member.remarks: - The time at which the asteroid was last tracked Stored in persistence file

member.name: P:DiscoveryInfo.Level
member.para: The level of knowledge available about this object
member.remarks: - The asteroid's tracking state Stored in persistence file as state

member.name: P:DiscoveryInfo.objectSize
member.para: The tracking signature size of the object
member.remarks: - The size class (A-E) of the asteroid Stored in persistence file as size

member.name: P:DiscoveryInfo.referenceLifetime
member.para: The maximum lifetime for any untracked discoverable. Used to gauge signal strength.
member.remarks: - The time for which an asteroid can go untracked if it starts at full signal strength Alternate definition: the time needed for the signal strength to fall by 1 unit. Always equals 86400 ScenarioDiscoverableObjects.maxUntrackedLifetime. For the default spawn settings, this is 1728000 seconds, or 20 Earth days. Stored in persistence file as refTime

member.name: P:DiscoveryInfo.unobservedLifetime
member.para: The time the object can remain unobserved and still be detected again (infinite unless specified)
member.remarks: - The time for which the asteroid can go untracked before it is deleted Stored in persistence file as lifetime

member.name: M:DiscoveryInfo.GetSignalLife(System.Double)
member.para: Returns a 1-0 value representing how close the object is to being lost

<parameterlist kind='param'><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>UT</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist> <simplesect kind='return'><para>
member.remarks: </simplesect> </para> - Returns the fraction of the asteroid's unobservedLifetime that remains
member.param: The time at which the signal life is measured
member.remarks: GetSignalLife(t_discover) == 1.0 GetSignalLife(fadeUT) == 0.0

member.name: M:DiscoveryInfo.GetSignalStrength(System.Double)
member.para: Returns a 1-0 value representing how long this object will stick around, compared to others spawned in similar circumstances.

<parameterlist kind='param'><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>UT</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist> <simplesect kind='return'><para>
member.remarks: </simplesect> </para> - Returns amount of time remaining until the asteroid is lost, in units of referenceLifetime
member.param: The time at which the signal strength is measured
member.remarks: GetSignalStrength(t_discover) == unobservedLifetime / referenceLifetime GetSignalStrength(fadeUT) == 0.0

member.name: T:EventData
member.summary: A type used to generate GameEvents Use this type with one accompanying type; GameEvents.FromToAction, GameEvents.HostedFromToAction, GameEvents.HostTargetAction are commonly used See EventVoid for events that require no parameters or EventReport for a different style
member.typeparam: The type to be passed through on EventData.Fire()

member.name: F:EventData.debugEvent
member.summary: Generate debug logs if true

member.name: M:EventData.Add(OnEvent)
member.summary: Add a method to be run when the EventData is fired. This is generally done in an object's Start or Awake method, or a class' constructor. Can be setup like: GameEvents.someEventDataEvent.Add(yourMethod); or GameEvents.someEventDataEvent.Add(new EventVoid.OnEvent(yourMethod));
member.param: The method you want to add; must contain a single parameter of the type matching that in the host EventData

member.name: M:EventData.Fire(T)
member.summary: Triggers the EventData All of the methods added using Add are run after this.
member.param: Single parameter matching the type of the host EventData Use this to give information relevant to the event

member.name: M:EventData.OnEvent(T)
member.summary: Any methods added to the event must match the delegate's parameters; one parameter of the given type in this case.

member.name: M:EventData.Remove(OnEvent)
member.summary: Remove a method from the list of methods to be run when the EventData is fired. This is generally done in an object's OnDestroy method.
member.param: The method you want to remove; must contain a single parameter of a type matching that in the host EventData

member.name: M:EventData.#ctor(string)
member.summary: The constructor used to create a new EventData EventData<Vessel> myNewEvent = new EventData<Vessel>("myNewEvent");
member.param: Give the event a string name, generally the same as the declared name

member.name: T:FXGroup
member.para: An FX group is a wrapper for a collection of effects. It abstracts the effects themselves, so it's possible to have any number of effects assigned to a group, or none. A group holds collections for particle emmiters, lights, and sound. All are executed when the effect is on. FX Groups are used by Parts, since the number or position of effect nodes is unknown. Instead of handling the effects themselves, the parts handle FXGroups

member.name: F:FXGroup.fxEmitters
member.para: A collection of gameObjects with particle emmiters

member.name: F:FXGroup.lights
member.para: A collection of gameObjects with Light Components

member.name: P:FXGroup.Power
member.para: controls the overall size of the effects.

member.name: M:FXGroup.Burst
member.para: Will do a single burst of all particle emmiters in the group

member.name: M:FXGroup.setActive(System.Boolean)
member.para: controls whether the effect is continuously active or not.

member.name: M:FXGroup.SetLatch(System.Boolean)
member.para: Sets the active group active state to true, but not to false. Use when effects are assigned to multiple conflicting groups. Don't forget to unlatch them.

<parameterlist kind='param'><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>latch</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist>

member.name: M:FXGroup.SetPower(System.Single)
member.para: Sets the active group power to the given value.

<parameterlist kind='param'><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>pwr</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist>
< Mathf.Clamp01(pwr);

member.name: M:FXGroup.SetPowerLatch(System.Single)
member.para: Sets the active group power to the given value, only if the given value is higher than the current one. Use to solve conflicts.

<parameterlist kind='param'><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>pwr</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist>

member.name: M:FXGroup.Unlatch
member.para: Deactivates the group, if it's been activated with SetLatch. Also resets all power latches

member.name: T:FlightGlobals
member.para: This class keeps all sorts of flight-related information that need to be accessed globally. Here are methods for sampling gravity, air pressure, temperature for any given flight state, as well as publicly available references to planet positions and other stuff.
member.remarks: - FlightGlobals contains lists of all CelestialBodies and Vessels in the game. It also provides static utility functions for computing the atmospheric and gravitational properties of CelestialBodies.

member.name: P:FlightGlobals.DragMultiplier
member.summary: The KSP formula for the drag force on a part is (1/2) * DragMultiplier * part.mass * part.mass_drag * airspeed^2

member.para: A handle to the input state. WARNING: Don't use this to read input state for part modules and such. Use vessel.ctrlState instead.

this script handles all keyboard input for the flight mode it dispatches a flight control update message for all parts that can respond this message contains a flightcontrolstate object, that holds the state of the input much like a snapshot of the cockpit controls

Textures should be cached by Unity, so in theory, calling this function twice should return the originally loaded instance. Making a duplicate would require use of the GameObject.Instantiate() function.

member.name: T:GameEvents
member.para: Static manager class which contains the global event system
member.remarks: - GameEvents are EventData or EventVoid methods called when certain conditions are met. Many include some relevant data on the objects affected when they are triggered. Use:
and

to add and remove methods from a list of methods to be called when the event is triggered. Methods are generally added in your object's Start or Awake method and generally removed in your object's OnDestroy method. Be sure not add methods multiple times withoud destroying them between additions.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onActiveJointNeedUpdate
member.para: Fired by components such as grapples and docking modules, before setting parts on the vessel to their pristine positions, so active joints can update their coords before operations involving orgPos and orgRot happen.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a vessel docks or attaches with the grappling device; fires twice, once for each vessel

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnAnimationGroupStateChanged
member.para: Called when <ref refid='class_module_animation_group' kindref='compound'>ModuleAnimationGroup</ref> changes states. Bool reflects the deploy state.

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnAppFocus
member.para: Even fired whenever the application gains or loses window focus

member.name: F:GameEvents.onAsteroidSpawned
member.para: Event called when an asteroid is spawned.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onAttemptEva
member.para: Fired when attempting an EVA. Transform is the airlock transform. Event handler should set FlightEVA.fetch.overrideEVA = true to cancel the EVA.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onAttemptTransfer
member.para: Fired when attempting a crew transfer. Event handler should set the hatch controller.overrideTransfer as needed.

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnCameraChange
member.para: Called after switching to a different camera (external, internal, map...)

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCollision
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Triggered when two parts collide

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnCollisionEnhancerHit
member.para: Event called when a part has a collision enhancer hit.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCommandSeatInteraction
member.para: Event fired when an EVA kerbal enters, exits, or loads into a command seat

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCommandSeatInteractionEnter
member.para: Event fired just before a EVA kerbal enters, exits, or loads into a command seat

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCrash
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a part or vessel crashes into the terrain

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCrashSplashdown
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a part crashes into the ocean

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCrewBoardVessel
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Triggered when an EVA Kerbal boards a vessel

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCrewKilled
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Triggered whenever a Kerbal dies; either on EVA or in a crashing vessel

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnCrewmemberHired
member.para: Event called whenever an applicant is hired at the Astronaut Complex. (second parameter is the new active crew count)
member.remarks: - Triggered when a Kerbal is hired

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnCrewmemberLeftForDead
member.para: Event called whenever a MIA applicant is left for dead at the Astronaut Complex. (second parameter is the new active crew count)

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnCrewmemberSacked
member.para: Event called whenever an applicant is sacked at the Astronaut Complex. (second parameter is the new active crew count)
member.remarks: - Triggered when Kerbal is sacked

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCrewOnEva
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a Kerbal goes on EVA

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCrewTransferPartListCreated
member.para: Event fired after set of valid and invalid parts for crew transfer is created but before they are used. First is valid, second is full parts.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCrewTransferred
member.para: Event fired right after a crewmember is moved from one part to another.
member.remarks: - Triggers when a Kerbal transfers from one part to another (occurs AFTER the transfer)

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCrewTransferSelected
member.para: Hook for any other things to intercept a crew transfer and do something themselves and/or cancel it (by setting canTransfer to false).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCustomWaypointLoad
member.para: Fired when loading a custom Waypoint, before looking at the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref>. Pass the Waypoint and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref>.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onCustomWaypointSave
member.para: Fired when saving a custom Waypoint, right before finishing. Pass the Waypoint and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref>.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onDominantBodyChange
member.para: Event called before the dominant body (Sphere of influence) will change 'from' the old 'to' the new dominant body, for the active vessel.
member.remarks: - Triggered when changing SOI; both objects return the new dominant CelestialBody See also onVesselSOIChanged

member.name: F:GameEvents.onEditorPodPicked
member.para: When picking the first rootpart after pressing new in the editor

member.name: F:GameEvents.onEditorPodSelected
member.para: When the rootpart is selected in editor

member.name: F:GameEvents.onEditorShipModified
member.para: Event called whenever the ship in the Editor is modified in any way
member.remarks: - Triggered when any part is added or removed from a vessel in the editor; also triggered when any tweakable settings are changed; also when undo is called

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnEfficiencyChange
member.para: Called when something changes the efficiency of anything deriving from <ref refid='class_base_converter' kindref='compound'>BaseConverter</ref>

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnExperimentDeployed
member.para: Event called after experiment is deployed, but before submission.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onFairingsDeployed
member.para: Event called when Procedural Fairings are deployed on the active vessel.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onFlagPlant
member.para: Event fired after a flag is planted with the flag vessel as the data
member.remarks: - When a flag is planted by an EVA Kerbal

member.name: F:GameEvents.onFlagSelect
member.para: Event called after a flag is selected for the space program.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a flag is selected from the space center's flag pole

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnFlightCameraAngleChange
member.para: Called when the flight camera changes angles

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnFlightCameraModeChange
member.summary: Triggers whenever the CameraMode in the CameraManager class changes

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnFlightGlobalsReady
member.para: Fired when FG sets its ready flag

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnFlightLogRecorded
member.para: Event called after a vessel records a new flight log entry.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onFlightReady
member.para: Event called after game is loaded, all vessels initialized etc. <ref refid='class_vessel' kindref='compound'>Vessel</ref> ready to fly.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a vessel is fully loaded

member.name: F:GameEvents.onFloatingOriginShift
member.para: Event called whenever <ref refid='class_floating_origin' kindref='compound'>FloatingOrigin</ref> shifts (parameter contains the last offset and the last additional out-of-Krakensbane-frame offset)
member.remarks: - Deprecated?

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnFundsChanged
member.para: Event called whenever the space program's Funds changes
member.remarks: - When Funds level changes, returns total Funds amount

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnGameDatabaseLoaded
member.para: Event called after <ref refid='class_game_database' kindref='compound'>GameDatabase</ref> finishes loading (or reloading).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGamePause
member.para: Event called before the game is paused
member.remarks: - When the game is paused

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGameSceneLoadRequested
member.para: Event called after a scene change is requested. But before the scene actually changes.
member.remarks: - Triggered upon scene change requests; returns the target GameScene

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGameSceneSwitchRequested
member.para: Event called after a scene change is requested. But before the scene actually changes.
member.remarks: - Is triggered just prior to a game scene change

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnGameSettingsApplied
member.para: Event fired whenever new settings are applied from the settings screen or mini settings screen (in flight)
member.remarks: - When Game Settings are applied in the main settings menu, or the in-game settings menu

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGameStateCreated
member.para: Event called after the game state is created.
member.remarks: - When a game is first created or loaded; returns the Game object

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGameStateLoad
member.para: Event whilst game is loading with confignode of game
member.remarks: - Triggered on loading a game, returns the game's full ConfigNode from the persistent file

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGameStatePostLoad
member.para: Event called after game is loaded

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGameStateSave
member.para: Event whilst game is saving with confignode of game
member.remarks: - Triggered on saving a game, returns the game's full ConfigNode from the persistent file

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGameStateSaved
member.para: Event called after the game is saved.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a game is saved, returns the Game object;

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGameUnpause
member.para: Event called before the game is un-paused
member.remarks: - When the game is unpaused

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIApplicationLauncherDestroyed
member.summary: When the application launcher (toolbar) is closed

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIApplicationLauncherReady
member.summary: Called when the ApplicationLauncher toolbar is ready to have buttons added to it.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIAstronautComplexDespawn
member.summary: When the astronaut complex window closes

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIAstronautComplexSpawn
member.summary: When the astronaut complex window opens; from the space center or editor

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIKSPediaDespawn
member.summary: Triggers when the KSPedia window is closed

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIKSPediaSpawn
member.summary: Triggers when the KSPedia window is opened

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUILaunchScreenDespawn
member.summary: When the vessel selection screen is closed or a vessel is selected and launched

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUILaunchScreenSpawn
member.para: Event called when the vessel launch dialog spawns
member.remarks: - When the launch screen (that allows you to view and select available vessels) is opened; after selecting the launchpad/runway from the space center. See VesselSpawnInfo for more on what is returned by this callback.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUILaunchScreenVesselSelected
member.para: Event fired when a vessel is selected in the launch dialog's craft list
member.remarks: - When a vessel is selected from the vessel selection screen at the space center

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIMessageSystemReady
member.summary: When the application launcher's message button is ready

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIMissionControlDespawn
member.summary: When the mission control center window closes

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIMissionControlSpawn
member.summary: When the mission control center window opens

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIPrefabLauncherReady
member.summary: When the application launcher (toolbar) loads; triggers before onGUIApplicationLauncherReady and onGUIMessageSystemReady

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIRecoveryDialogDespawn
member.summary: When the recovery dialog window closes

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIRecoveryDialogSpawn
member.summary: When the recovery dialog window opens

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIRnDComplexDespawn
member.summary: When the R&D center window closes

member.name: F:GameEvents.onGUIRnDComplexSpawn
member.summary: When the R&D center window opens

member.name: F:GameEvents.onHideUI
member.summary: Called when the player hides the UI by pressing F2. Register for this callback (and for onShowUI) so that you can hide your UI too.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onInputLocksModified
member.para: Event fired when the input lock mask was modified. Use to update components that react to being locked off, like disabling buttons and such.
member.remarks: - Triggered when input locks are activated or deactivated; when putting the mouse over one window/button locks the controls of another window/button

member.name: F:GameEvents.onItemTransferStarted
member.para: Hook so things can change the just-started item transfer UI thingie

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnIVACameraKerbalChange
member.para: Called when the IVA camera changes kerbals
Does not get called when switching to a fixed internal viewpoint (<ref refid='class_internal_camera' kindref='compound'>InternalCamera</ref> mode) or swithcing out of IVA. Use OnCameraChange for that
member.remarks: - This event is triggered every time the camera switches to another Kerbal in IVA mode

member.name: F:GameEvents.onJointBreak
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Deprecated? Use onPartJointBreak

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKerbalAdded
member.para: Fired when a kerbal is added to the roster
member.remarks: - Triggered when a new Kerbal is added in the astronaut complex scene; also triggered when a rescue Kerbal contract is generated

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKerbalInactiveChange
member.para: Fired when a kerbal's 'active' flag changes

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKerbalLevelUp
member.para: Fired when a kerbal levels up

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKerbalNameChange
member.para: Fired when a kerbal changes from one name to another

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKerbalPassedOutFromGeeForce
member.para: Fired when a kerbal becomes inactive due to gee forces

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKerbalRemoved
member.para: Fired when a kerbal is removed from the roster
member.remarks: - Triggered when a Kerbal is removed from the roster in the astronaut complex; also triggered when a rescue Kerbal contract is failed, expires, or declined

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKerbalStatusChange
member.para: Fired when a kerbal changes from one status
member.remarks: - Triggered when the ProtoCrewMember.RosterStatus changes; usually upon vessel recovery, new crew addition, or death; returns the ProtoCrewMember and its old and new status

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKerbalTypeChange
member.para: Fired when a kerbal changes from one kerbal type to another
member.remarks: - Triggered when the ProtoCrewMember.KerbalType changes; KerbalTypes are possibly not fully implemented; occurs upon hiring crew or rescuing Kerbal

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKnowledgeChanged
member.para: Event called after an object has changed it's knowledge situation. (I.e. <ref refid='class_vessel' kindref='compound'>Vessel</ref> tracking starts and changes knowledge of state vectors to true)
member.remarks: - Triggered upon starting or stopping asteroid tracking, or when approaching an asteroid

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKrakensbaneDisengage
member.para: Event called when <ref refid='class_krakensbane' kindref='compound'>Krakensbane</ref> turns off and returns velocities to the rigidbodies (parameter contains the velocity change)
member.remarks: - Triggered when a vessel's velocity falls below ~750m/s

member.name: F:GameEvents.onKrakensbaneEngage
member.para: Event called when <ref refid='class_krakensbane' kindref='compound'>Krakensbane</ref> kicks in from a non-speeding reference frame (parameter contains the velocity change)
member.remarks: - Triggered when a vessel's velocity reaches ~750m/s

member.name: F:GameEvents.onLanguageSwitched
member.para: Fired when language is switched

member.name: F:GameEvents.onLaunch
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Triggered when launching by activating the first stage

member.name: F:GameEvents.onLevelWasLoaded
member.para: Event called after a scene is loaded.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a new scene is loaded; returns that GameScene; occurs after onGameSceneLoadRequested

member.name: F:GameEvents.onLevelWasLoadedGUIReady
member.para: Event called after a scene is loaded and UIManager is instantiated (where applicable). Use this when you absolutely want to make sure everything stock is loaded.

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnMapEntered
member.summary: Triggers when Map mode is entered in flight scene

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnMapExited
member.summary: Triggers when Map mode is exited in flight scene

member.name: F:GameEvents.onMissionFlagSelect
member.para: Event called after a flag is selected for the mission.
member.remarks: - Triggered when selecting a new flag from in the editor; returns the flag texture's GameDatabse URL

member.name: F:GameEvents.onNewVesselCreated
member.para: Event called when new vessels are spawned into the game after the scene is loaded. (e.g., an asteroid being "detected" or a contract creating a vessel).
member.remarks: - Triggered when spawning a new asteroid or a new Kerbal for a rescue Kerbal contract

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnOrbitalSurveyCompleted
member.para: Called when <ref refid='class_module_orbital_surveyor' kindref='compound'>ModuleOrbitalSurveyor</ref> finishes a survey of a body.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onOverG
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onOverheat
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a part overheats; returns an EventReport with the part name

member.name: F:GameEvents.onOverPressure
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartActionUICreate
member.para: Event called when a part has its action UI opened.
member.remarks: - Triggered when right-clicking a part; returns that part; triggered every time a part event is selected

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartActionUIDismiss
member.para: Event called when a part has its action UI closed.
member.remarks: - Triggered when closing the right-click menu of a part

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartAttach
member.para: Event called before a 'host' part is attached to a 'target' part (in editor and flight).
member.remarks: - Triggered when adding a part in the editor, when docking, and when another vessel comes into range and is loaded; returns the part and its new parent part

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartCouple
member.para: Event called before a part coupling is occuring 'from' one part 'to' another part.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a docking port or asteroid grappling device attaches; returns the host part and the target part

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartCrossfeedStateChange
member.para: Fired when the crossfeed state of a <ref refid='class_part' kindref='compound'>Part</ref> changes

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartDestroyed
member.para: Event called when a part is destroyed, regardless of whether it died or not (as might happen when leaving a scene).
member.remarks: - Triggered when a part object's OnDestroy method is called; occurs any time a part or vessel is unloaded, ie scene changes or vessel moving out of loading distance

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartDie
member.para: Event called before a part is destroyed, after it's been marked dead. Just after <ref refid='class_part_1ab61e36a6bbdeaedca0360cfe8066aef2' kindref='member'>Part.OnJustAboutToBeDestroyed()</ref>.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a part is destroyed, usually by exploding/crashing

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartExplode
member.para: Event called when a part is destroyed violently, such as when crashing or overheating. Event happens before <ref refid='class_part_1a908d070b8770abfbebf7f488ce9ef000' kindref='member'>Part.Die</ref> is called.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a part explodes, usually due to crashing into the ground or into another part; also triggered by a part overheating and exploding

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartFuelLookupStateChange
member.para: Fired when the crossfeed state of a fuel line (or other thing that changes fuel lookup targets) changes <ref refid='class_part' kindref='compound'>Part</ref> are part drawn from (the target) and part drawn to (the list host), bool is whether it's bidirectional

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartJointBreak
member.para: Event Called whenever a part joint breaks or is destroyed for any reason.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a part decouples, undocks, a grappling device undocks, a strut breaks, a part is destroyed, or when a part is removed in the editor

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartJointSet
member.para: Event Called whenever a part joint configuration is reset.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartLadderEnter
member.para: Fired when a kerbal grabs a ladder attached to a part

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartLadderExit
member.para: Fired when a kerbal leaves a ladder attached to a part

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnPartLoaderLoaded
member.para: Event called after <ref refid='class_part_loader' kindref='compound'>PartLoader</ref> finishes loading (or reloading).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartPack
member.para: Event called when a part is being packed for rails (use onVesselGoOnRails if you only need one call for the whole vessel packing up)
member.remarks: - Triggered when a part goes on rails (enters timewarp) or exits loading distance

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartPriorityChanged
member.para: Fired when a part's staging index or priority offset changes.

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnPartPurchased
member.para: Fired when a part is purchased so funding can listen for it
member.remarks: - Triggered when purchasing a part in the R&D center; currently (KSP 0.24.2) called for all parts in a tech node when researching that node

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartRemove
member.para: Event called before a 'host' part is removed from a 'target' part (in editor and flight).
member.remarks: - Triggered when removing a part in the editor

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartResourceEmptyFull
member.para: Fired when a <ref refid='class_part_resource' kindref='compound'>PartResource</ref>'s amount goes from 0 to full
member.remarks: - This event fires if you are transferring resources between parts and the amount to transfer in is more than the capacity of the part receiving the resource and it was empty before the transfer begun (resulting in the receiving part being full).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartResourceEmptyNonempty
member.para: Fired when a <ref refid='class_part_resource' kindref='compound'>PartResource</ref>'s amount goes from 0 to >0 (but not full)
member.remarks: - This event fires if you are transferring resources between parts and the amount to transfer in is less than the capacity of the part receiving the resource and it was empty before the transfer begun.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartResourceFlowModeChange
member.para: Fired when the flow mode of a <ref refid='class_part_resource' kindref='compound'>PartResource</ref> changes (does not appear to ever happen)

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartResourceFlowStateChange
member.para: Fired when the flow state of a <ref refid='class_part_resource' kindref='compound'>PartResource</ref> changes

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartResourceFullEmpty
member.para: Fired when a <ref refid='class_part_resource' kindref='compound'>PartResource</ref>'s amount goes from full to 0
member.remarks: - This event fires if you are transferring resources between parts and the amount transfered results in the from part going from full capacity to empty capacity.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartResourceFullNonempty
member.para: Fired when a <ref refid='class_part_resource' kindref='compound'>PartResource</ref>'s amount goes from Full to >0
member.remarks: - This event fires if you are transferring resources between parts and the amount transfered results in the from part going from full capacity and it still has some resource left in it at the end of the transfer.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartResourceListChange
member.para: Called when a partresource is added or removed from a part's resoruce list

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartResourceNonemptyEmpty
member.para: Fired when a <ref refid='class_part_resource' kindref='compound'>PartResource</ref>'s amount goes from >0 to empty
member.remarks: - This event fires if you are transferring resources between parts and the amount transferredis less than the capacity of the part receiving the resource and it was not empty before the transfer begun.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartResourceNonemptyFull
member.para: Fired when a <ref refid='class_part_resource' kindref='compound'>PartResource</ref>'s amount goes from >0 (but not full) to full
member.remarks: - This event fires if you are transferring resources between parts and the receiving part had some resource to begin with and it still has some resource left in it at the end of the trasfer (the receiving part is now full).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartUndock
member.para: Event called before a 'part' is undocked.
member.remarks: - Triggered upon undock event/action; not triggered by a docking node's decouple event; also triggered by asteroid grappling device's release event

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPartUnpack
member.para: Event called when a part is being unpacked from rails (use onVesselGoOffRails if you only need one call for the whole vessel unpacking)
member.remarks: - Triggered when a part goes off rails (exits timewarp) or comes into loading distance

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnPartUpgradePurchased
member.para: Fired when a part upgrade is purchased so funding can listen for it

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPhysicsEaseStart
member.para: Called when the <ref refid='class_vessel_precalculate' kindref='compound'>VesselPrecalculate</ref> component engages physics easing.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPhysicsEaseStop
member.para: Called when the <ref refid='class_vessel_precalculate' kindref='compound'>VesselPrecalculate</ref> component ends physics easing.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onPlanetariumTargetChanged
member.para: Event called after the <ref refid='class_map_view' kindref='compound'>MapView</ref> target changes. <ref refid='class_map_object' kindref='compound'>MapObject</ref> will be null when no target is selected (can only happen in tracking station). Possible issue: Fires twice when entering <ref refid='class_map_view' kindref='compound'>MapView</ref> for the first time (if you exit mapview and then enter again, it fires once)
member.remarks: - Triggered when the map view or tracking station camera focuses on a new object; this can be a Celestial Body or vessel; also triggered when switching to or loading a new vessel

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnPQSCityLoaded
member.para: Simple event called when a <ref refid='class_p_q_s_city' kindref='compound'>PQSCity</ref> comes within vessel loading range of the active vessel.

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnPQSCityStarting
member.para: Simple event called when a <ref refid='class_p_q_s_city' kindref='compound'>PQSCity</ref> is starting up.

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnPQSCityUnloaded
member.para: Simple event called when a <ref refid='class_p_q_s_city' kindref='compound'>PQSCity</ref> leaves vessel loading range of the active vessel.

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnPQSStarting
member.para: Fired just before a <ref refid='class_p_q_s' kindref='compound'>PQS</ref> sphere starts up.

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnProgressAchieved
member.para: Event called every time the progress node hits its completion criteria, even if it's been completed before. Won't modify saved 'firsts'.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a ProgressNode and all of its subNodes are completed. See also OnProgressReached and OnProgressComplete

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnProgressComplete
member.para: Event called when a progress node hits "Completed" status. After this is called, the node won't modify its save data anymore, and will only fire 'achieved' events for repeat ocurrences.
member.remarks: - Triggered when all sub ProgressNodes within a given ProgressNode are completed; records the UT of node completion and returns the ProgressNode See the ProgressTracking module in the persistent.sfs file for more on how ProgressNodes are setup and saved. If the ProgressNode is completed upon first achievement this will also trigger OnProgressReached. See also OnProgressReached and OnProgressAchieved

member.name: F:GameEvents.onProgressNodeLoad
member.para: Fired when loading a Progress Node, before looking at the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref>. Pass the <ref refid='class_progress_node' kindref='compound'>ProgressNode</ref> and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref>

member.name: F:GameEvents.onProgressNodeSave
member.para: Fired when saving a Progress Node, right before finishing. Pass the <ref refid='class_progress_node' kindref='compound'>ProgressNode</ref> and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref>

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnProgressReached
member.para: Event called when a progress node hits "Reached" status. At this point it will start getting saved.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a ProgressNode is first reached but not completed; records the UT of node achievement and returns the ProgressNode. For instance, when a vessels first enters the SOI of a new Celestial Body the event will trigger and a "reached" entry will be added to the persistent.sfs file. If a ProgressNode is completed at the same time it is reached (ie has no ProgressNode subNodes) OnProgressCompelete will be triggered at the same time See the ProgressTracking module in the persistent.sfs file for more on how ProgressNodes are setup and saved. See also OnProgressComplete and OnProgressAchieved

member.name: F:GameEvents.onProtoCrewMemberLoad
member.para: Fired when loading a <ref refid='class_proto_crew_member' kindref='compound'>ProtoCrewMember</ref>, before looking at the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref>. Pass the <ref refid='class_proto_crew_member' kindref='compound'>ProtoCrewMember</ref> and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref>, or null if copying from another PCM.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onProtoCrewMemberSave
member.para: Fired when saving a <ref refid='class_proto_crew_member' kindref='compound'>ProtoCrewMember</ref>, right before finishing. Pass the <ref refid='class_proto_crew_member' kindref='compound'>ProtoCrewMember</ref> and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref>.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onProtoPartModuleSnapshotLoad
member.para: Fired when loading a <ref refid='class_proto_part_module_snapshot' kindref='compound'>ProtoPartModuleSnapshot</ref>, before the node is read. Pass <ref refid='class_proto_part_module_snapshot' kindref='compound'>ProtoPartModuleSnapshot</ref> and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> (or null if creating the <ref refid='class_part_module' kindref='compound'>PartModule</ref>).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onProtoPartModuleSnapshotSave
member.para: Fired when saving a <ref refid='class_proto_part_module_snapshot' kindref='compound'>ProtoPartModuleSnapshot</ref>, right before finishing. Pass <ref refid='class_proto_part_module_snapshot' kindref='compound'>ProtoPartModuleSnapshot</ref> and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> (or null if going from <ref refid='class_part_module' kindref='compound'>PartModule</ref> to this).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onProtoPartSnapshotLoad
member.para: Fired when loading a <ref refid='class_proto_part_snapshot' kindref='compound'>ProtoPartSnapshot</ref>, before the node is read. Pass <ref refid='class_proto_part_snapshot' kindref='compound'>ProtoPartSnapshot</ref> and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> (or null if creating the <ref refid='class_part' kindref='compound'>Part</ref>).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onProtoPartSnapshotSave
member.para: Fired when saving a <ref refid='class_proto_part_snapshot' kindref='compound'>ProtoPartSnapshot</ref>, right before finishing. Pass <ref refid='class_proto_part_snapshot' kindref='compound'>ProtoPartSnapshot</ref> and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> (or null if creating from <ref refid='class_part' kindref='compound'>Part</ref>).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onProtoVesselLoad
member.para: Fired when loading a <ref refid='class_proto_vessel' kindref='compound'>ProtoVessel</ref>, before the node is read. Pass <ref refid='class_proto_vessel' kindref='compound'>ProtoVessel</ref> and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> (or null if pushing to vessel from a loaded <ref refid='class_proto_vessel' kindref='compound'>ProtoVessel</ref>).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onProtoVesselSave
member.para: Fired when saving a <ref refid='class_proto_vessel' kindref='compound'>ProtoVessel</ref>, right before finishing. Pass <ref refid='class_proto_vessel' kindref='compound'>ProtoVessel</ref> and the <ref refid='class_config_node' kindref='compound'>ConfigNode</ref> (or null if creating from <ref refid='class_vessel' kindref='compound'>Vessel</ref>).

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnReputationChanged
member.para: Event called whenever the space program's reputation changes
member.remarks: - When reputation level changes; returns total rep amount

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnResourceConverterOutput
member.para: Event called when a resource is produced by a <ref refid='class_resource_converter' kindref='compound'>ResourceConverter</ref>.

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnResourceMapLoaded
member.para: Called when the resource map is initialized - can take a few frames

member.name: F:GameEvents.onRotatingFrameTransition
member.para: Event called whenever a rotating reference frame is enabled or disabled (parameter contains the dominant body, and whether a rotating frame is currently in effect or not). Use host.GetRFrameVel(wPos) to find out the velocity of the rotating frame at the given position, subtract frame vel if the Target bool is true, add if false.
member.remarks: - Triggered when reference frame changes (ie from inertial to rotating); this is generally accompanied by a shift in the camera position and a debug log message ("Reference Frame: Rotating/Inertial")

member.name: F:GameEvents.onSameVesselDock
member.para: Event called after a docking connection is established on the same vessel. (The vessel of the 'from node' is the same as the vessel of the 'to node', before and after docking)
member.remarks: - Triggered when two docking ports on the same vessel dock together

member.name: F:GameEvents.onSameVesselUndock
member.para: Event called after a docking connection is released on the same vessel. (The vessel of the 'from node' is the same as the vessel of the 'to node', before and after undocking)
member.remarks: - Triggered when two docking ports on the same vessel undock

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnScienceChanged
member.para: Event called whenever the space program's science changes
member.remarks: - When science level changes; returns total science amount

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnScienceRecieved
member.para: Event called when science is submitted to R&D
member.remarks: - Triggered science data is transmitted or recovered; returns the amount of science and the ScienceSubject

member.name: F:GameEvents.onScreenResolutionModified
member.para: Event called once per frame if the screen resolution changes.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onShowUI
member.summary: Called when the player un-hides the UI by pressing F2. Register for this callback (and onHideUI) so that you can un-hide your UI too.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onSplashDamage
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Triggered when engine exhaust damages another part

member.name: F:GameEvents.onStageActivate
member.para: Event called before the given stage 'int' is activated on the active vessel.
member.remarks: - Triggered upon staging, returns the stage number

member.name: F:GameEvents.onStageSeparation
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Triggered by decoupler staging; also triggered by separation through a decoupler's right-click menu event

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnTechnologyResearched
member.summary: Triggered when researching a tech node in the R&D center; triggers whether or not you have enough science to unlock the node

member.name: F:GameEvents.onTimeWarpRateChanged
member.para: Event called after the warprate has changed.
member.remarks: - Triggered whenever timewarp rate changes; applies to physics and non-physics timewarp; triggered by the key press also (called even if you are at max/min timewarp already)

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnTriggeredDataTransmission
member.para: Event called when a triggered data transmission fully completes. Used in special transmissions such as those from the science lab.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onUndock
member.para: <ref refid='class_flight_logger' kindref='compound'>FlightLogger</ref> event. Internal and due for an overhaul.
member.remarks: - Deprecated? Use onPartUndock

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnUpgradesFilled
member.para: Fired after FillUpgrades() runs

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnUpgradesLinked
member.para: Fired after LinkUpgrades() runs

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselChange
member.para: Event called when the active vessel changes.
member.remarks: - Triggered when switching to a different vessel, loading a vessel, or launching

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselControlStateChange
member.para: Event called after a vessel has changed it's situation. (I.e. <ref refid='class_vessel' kindref='compound'>Vessel</ref> situation changes from prelaunch to flying)

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselCreate
member.para: Event called when a vessel is spawned into the scene, usually during loading.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a vessel is launched, or created by undocking, decoupling, planting a flag, or EVA; also triggered by new asteroid creation and rescue Kerbal contracts

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselCrewWasModified
member.para: Event called after a vessel had its crew modified in some way (added, removed, or killed).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselDestroy
member.para: Event called before a vessel will be destroyed.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a vessel instance is destroyed; any time a vessel is unloaded, ie scene changes, exiting loading distance

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselGoOffRails
member.para: Event called after a vessel has gone off rails.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a vessel is loaded on the launchpad, when a vessel enters within loading distance, or when a vessel goes off of time warp

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselGoOnRails
member.para: Event called before a vessel goes on rails.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a vessel exits loading distance or enters time warp

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselLoaded
member.para: Event called after a vessel has been loaded.
member.remarks: - Triggered whenever a vessel's load method is called

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselOrbitClosed
member.para: Event called when a vessel's orbit changes from hyperbolic to closed.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a closed orbit is reached

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselOrbitEscaped
member.para: Event called when a vessel's orbit changes from closed to hyperbolic.
member.remarks: - Triggered when orbit eccentricity becomes > 1

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselPartCountChanged
member.para: Event called in FixedUpdate if a vessel's part count changes, useful if onVesselWasModified misses something.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselPrecalcAssign
member.para: Event called right before a vessel's <ref refid='class_vessel_precalculate' kindref='compound'>VesselPrecalculate</ref> component is added so something else can add a different one.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselRecovered
member.para: Event called when a vessel is recovered off the game (as opposed to being terminated). Parameter is protovessel as vessel may not be loaded.
member.remarks: - Triggered after a vessel has been recovered and the science data and part values have been accounted for; occurs in the space center or tracking station. Triggered after onVesselRecoveryProcessing

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselRecoveryProcessing
member.para: Event called when a vessel is recovered off the game (as opposed to being terminated). Parameter is protovessel as vessel may not be loaded.
member.remarks: - Triggered in the space center or tracking station when a vessel is recovered; occurs before onVesselRecovered

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnVesselRecoveryRequested
member.para: Event called when the player requests that the current vessel be recovered after returning to space center. Most likely will be followed by a scene change
member.remarks: - Triggered a vessel is recovered (the big green button at the top) from the flight scene

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselReferenceTransformSwitch
member.para: Fired when the vessel's reference transform is set

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselRename
member.para: Event called after a vessel name will change 'from' a name 'to' another name.
member.remarks: - Returns old 'from' vessel name and new 'to' vessel name

member.name: F:GameEvents.OnVesselRollout
member.para: Event called when a new vessel is rolled out to the launchpad prior to launch
member.remarks: - Triggered when vessel is loaded onto the launchpad from the editor/launch selection window; called after the transition to flight scene

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselSituationChange
member.para: Event called after a vessel has changed it's situation. (I.e. <ref refid='class_vessel' kindref='compound'>Vessel</ref> situation changes from prelaunch to flying)
member.remarks: - Returns old and new vessel situations

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselSOIChanged
member.para: Event called when a vessel switches to a different SOI.
member.remarks: - Returns old and new Celestial Body

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselStandardModification
member.para: Event called by <ref refid='class_flight_globals' kindref='compound'>FlightGlobals</ref> when a vessel is modified in ANY conceivable way (docking, explosions, part count changing, whatever).

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselSwitching
member.para: Fired when vessel focus is switching to a loaded vessel (just before <ref refid='class_flight_globals_1a5f4999c6efd1b060ea887c3f091745eb' kindref='member'>FlightGlobals.ActiveVessel</ref> is actually set). Similar to OnVesselChange, but parameters contain both 'from' and 'to' vessels.
member.remarks: - This even triggers whenever a switch occurs from one vessel to another

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselSwitchingToUnloaded
member.para: Fired when vessel focus is switching to an unloaded vessel.

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselTerminated
member.para: Event called when a vessel is terminated off the game (as opposed to being recovered). Parameter is protovessel as vessel may not be loaded.
member.remarks: - Triggered when a vessel is deleted from the tracking station

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselWasModified
member.para: Event called after a vessel had its parts modified in some way (added or removed). <ref refid='class_vessel' kindref='compound'>Vessel</ref> parameter refers to the modified vessel, not new ones that may have spawned as a result.
member.remarks: - Triggered when any aspect of a vessel changes; docking, undocking, decoupling, parts breaking, crash, etc...

member.name: F:GameEvents.onVesselWillDestroy
member.para: Event called just before a vessel is about to be destroyed. (it is non null at this point).
member.remarks: - Triggered when a vessel crashes, or passes into the atmosphere; when an EVA Kerbal boards, or when an asteroid is despawned

member.name: F:GameEvents.onWheelRepaired
member.para: Event called when a wheel is repaired

member.name: M:GameEvents.FindEvent(string)
member.para: Searches for an event with the given name and type. Note that name uniqueness is not checked, so this should only be used for global events (not one that is stored as a non-singleton class member).
<parameterlist kind='templateparam'><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>T</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>The type of the event to search for.
member.remarks: eventName The name of the event to search for. The event, if found. - Allows mods to register their own events see http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/153112-ksp-122-gameevents-extension/
